messages.subject: The Infinite Monkey Cage
messages.msgSnippet: Rachel’s great link to No Such Thing as a Fish reminded me of The Infinite Monkey Cage which is a BBC radio broadcast hosted by Brian Cox and Robin Ince, and
messages.messageBody:
Rachel’s great link to No Such Thing as a Fish reminded me of The Infinite Monkey Cage which is a BBC radio broadcast hosted by Brian Cox and Robin Ince, and bills itself as a “Witty, irreverent look at the world according to science...”
 
The podcasts are here: http://www.bbc.co.uk/podcasts/series/timc  
 
And this Wikipedia page has a list of episodes. http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Infinite_Monkey_Cage
 
It’s quite funny.
 
Deb Lewis

messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] No such thing as a fish
messages.msgSnippet: And another thing.  This is great because you can skim it easily, and the podcasts are right there, and you can get a notification of a new one.
messages.messageBody:
And another thing. This is great because you can skim it easily, and the podcasts are right there, and you can get a notification of a new one.
https://twitter.com/qikipedia

Tons of brief trivia, some with images, some with moving gifs or video.

messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] No such thing as a fish
messages.msgSnippet: I m listening to one of those podcasts now! The program QI is fun.  It stands for Quite Interesting. I learned about it visiting Schuyler when her family
messages.messageBody:
I'm listening to one of those podcasts now!

The program "QI" is fun. It stands for "Quite Interesting."
I learned about it visiting Schuyler when her family was still in the UK.

https://www.youtube.com/user/TheQIElves
There's there youtube channel.

VERY interesting programs, painless, short, silly, but fun trivia.

Sandra

messages.subject: No such thing as a fish
messages.msgSnippet: My daughter and I have started listening to these great funny and interesting podcasts before we go to bed, and I thought I would share them here and maybe add
messages.messageBody:
My daughter and I have started listening to these great funny and interesting podcasts before we go to bed, and I thought I would share them here and maybe add a bit of cheer. I hope that's ok. 

They are by the writers of the English TV programme QI and is their most interesting facts of the week. They remind me of Sandra's  ideas about connections and joining the dots :) 

http://sandradodd.com/connections/


https://itunes.apple.com/gb/podcast/no-such-thing-as-a-fish/id840986946?mt=2&i=278269835

Rachel and Leila :)
